title: What determines if a fluid can create bubbles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because the surface tension—the forces holding the molecules of a liquid together—of water is too high. When detergent is added to water, it lowers the surface tension so that bubbles can form. Ref & further info : Blow the Best Bubbles
As per boundary law it is under transition state or going to trbulance nature where eddies formation under progress.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Aditya Singh Rathore
